articles.headline: How One Oligarch Used Shell Companies and Wall Street Ties to Invest in the U.S.
articles.snippet: Using a network of banks, law firms and advisers in multiple countries, Roman Abramovich invested billions in American hedge funds.
articles.abstract: Using a network of banks, law firms and advisers in multiple countries, Roman Abramovich invested billions in American hedge funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and David Enrich

articles.headline: As Mariupol Is Bombed and Besieged, Those Trapped Fight to Survive
articles.snippet: For three weeks, the Ukrainian port city has been without water, heat, electricity and all communication under a merciless Russian assault. Here’s what its residents have been enduring.
articles.abstract: For three weeks, the Ukrainian port city has been without water, heat, electricity and all communication under a merciless Russian assault. Here’s what its residents have been enduring.
articles.lead_paragraph: LVIV, Ukraine — Eduard Zarubin, a doctor, has lost everything. But he does still have his life.

articles.headline: Russians Pound Ukrainian Cities, as Biden Rallies Anti-Kremlin Alliance
articles.snippet: A powerful explosion ruined a shopping mall in Kyiv and claimed several lives, while Ukraine refused a Russian demand to surrender the devastated city of Mariupol.
articles.abstract: A powerful explosion ruined a shopping mall in Kyiv and claimed several lives, while Ukraine refused a Russian demand to surrender the devastated city of Mariupol.
articles.lead_paragraph: KYIV, Ukraine — Strikes on cities across Ukraine left a patchwork of death and destruction on Monday, including one that blasted a once-bustling shopping mall in Kyiv into a smoldering ruin with one of the most powerful explosions to hit the city since Russia’s war on Ukraine began.
articles.byline: By Neil MacFarquhar and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: Boeing Faces New Upheaval After Crash of Chinese Airliner
articles.snippet: No fault has been found, but the company, which has been trying to overcome a recent legacy of design and production troubles, is likely to get scrutinized.
articles.abstract: No fault has been found, but the company, which has been trying to overcome a recent legacy of design and production troubles, is likely to get scrutinized.
articles.lead_paragraph: The crash of a Boeing jet in China on Monday is the latest crisis for the American plane manufacturer, raising the prospect of renewed regulatory scrutiny and confronting the company with another catastrophe involving its planes.

articles.headline: Jackson Vows to Be Independent on Supreme Court if Confirmed
articles.snippet: On the first day of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson’s confirmation hearings, Republican senators began previewing attack lines accusing her of being soft on crime.
articles.abstract: On the first day of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson’s confirmation hearings, Republican senators began previewing attack lines accusing her of being soft on crime.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson on Monday emphasized “my duty to be independent” if confirmed as the first Black woman on the Supreme Court, as Republican senators almost immediately began previewing attack lines accusing her of being lenient on crime.

articles.headline: Bitcoin Miners Want to Recast Themselves as Eco-Friendly
articles.snippet: Facing intense criticism, the crypto mining industry is trying to change the view that its energy-guzzling computers are harmful to the climate.
articles.abstract: Facing intense criticism, the crypto mining industry is trying to change the view that its energy-guzzling computers are harmful to the climate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Along a dirt-covered road deep in Texas farm country, the cryptocurrency company Argo Blockchain is building a power plant for the internet age: a crypto “mining” site stocked with computers that generate new Bitcoins.

articles.headline: How Ukraine’s Outgunned Air Force Is Fighting Back Against Russian Jets
articles.snippet: Aerial dogfights. Top Gun-style duels. Ukraine’s fighter pilots are badly outnumbered but have so far kept Russia from controlling the skies.
articles.abstract: Aerial dogfights. Top Gun-style duels. Ukraine’s fighter pilots are badly outnumbered but have so far kept Russia from controlling the skies.
articles.lead_paragraph: LVIV, Ukraine — Each night, Ukrainian pilots like Andriy loiter in an undisclosed aircraft hangar, waiting, waiting, until the tension is broken with a shouted, one-word command: “Air!”
articles.byline: By Maria Varenikova and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: ‘Harry Potter for Adults’: Netflix Lures ‘Bridgerton’ Fans With Live Events
articles.snippet: A royal ball inspired by the popular Shonda Rhimes show aims to encourage the kind of water-cooler buzz that streaming services have struggled to create.
articles.abstract: A royal ball inspired by the popular Shonda Rhimes show aims to encourage the kind of water-cooler buzz that streaming services have struggled to create.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The wisteria drips from the archway while classical music plays over the loudspeakers. Powder-wigged valets present champagne to guests who gaze at Empire-waist dresses, peer into a room filled with makeup and accessories or head to a stage for a quick oil portrait (actually a digital photo with a Regency England-esque filter).
